perturbation.changed_text: Consistent with paragraph 15(c) of the Agreement, Licensee shall forfeit the Guarantee paid to date of ***** dollars ***** The omitted portions of this exhibit have been filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to a request for confidential treatment under Rule 406 promulgated under the Securities Act of 1933. Source: GLU MOBILE INC, S-1/A, 3/19/2007 (US$*****), but this forfeiture may be waived at Fox's sole discretion, and shall immediately pay the remaining Guarantee of ***** dollars (US$*****), equaling a total Guarantee payment by Licensee to Fox of ***** dollars (US$*****) ("Guarantee Forfeiture Payment").
perturbation.explanation: Adding a clause that the guarantee forfeiture may be waived introduces ambiguity and contradicts the initial statement that the licensee *shall* forfeit the guarantee. This makes the financial obligation less enforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Enforceability of Financial Obligations

perturbation.original_text: MUTUTAL RELEASE: With the exception of Licensee's Royalties payment obligations with respect to all Wireless Products released as of the date of this Amendment, and the obligations set forth in this Amendment, neither party shall have any further obligation under the Agreement, and all claims arising under the Agreement shall be mutually released.
perturbation.changed_text: MUTUTAL RELEASE: With the exception of Licensee's Royalties payment obligations with respect to all Wireless Products released as of the date of this Amendment, and the obligations set forth in this Amendment, neither party shall have any further obligation under the Agreement unless previously agreed upon, and all claims arising under the Agreement shall be mutually released.
perturbation.explanation: Adding 'unless previously agreed upon' introduces a loophole in the mutual release clause. This weakens the clause by allowing for prior agreements to supersede the release, creating potential disputes about which obligations still stand.
